sentences.sContent: There were no injuries or damage, but the attack raised the prospect of further Israeli retaliation.
sentences.sContent_eng: There were no injuries or damage, but the attack raised the prospect of further Israeli retaliation.
sentences.sCn: 这次袭击没有造成伤亡或者破坏，但是却使以色列有可能进一步报复。

sentences.sContent: The residents and witnesses all spoke on condition of anonymity for fear of retaliation.
sentences.sContent_eng: The residents and witnesses all spoke on condition of anonymity for fear of retaliation.
sentences.sCn: 传播短信的居民和目击者出于害怕报复的考虑均采用匿名。

remMethod.val: re(反) + tali(邪恶) + ation → 把邪恶还回去 → 报复

trans.tranOther: action against someone who has done something bad to you
